page.title: 08KATHERINE ELLIOT CENTRE.
page.content: The Katherine Elliot Centre is one of the main day centres in the Borders caring for handicapped people. It is situated just off the main A7 Hawick to Edinburgh road, close to the town centre. The centre was opened in l973 and it was named after a local landowner Baroness Elliot, who contributed some of the funds, and it has since been visited by a number of important people, including the Queen. We interviewed Mr. Norman who runs the centre and also spoke to his deputy manager. The centre is used to look after both mentally and physically handicapped adults. They come from as far away as Melrose, Kelso and Jedburgh and travel in a minibus. Most members come five days a week but some come in less than this. The centre opens at 9 a.m. and the members arrive after this and leave at 4 p.m.
